EDIT:
It seems to me that Capcom is trading one set of fans for another. And though the action-orentied fans may make up the majority -- at least according to wherever they got that info -- it leaves devoted fans out in the Cold. I just don't understand the logic behind this; if they wanted to Reach a broader audience they ought to just develop an entirely new game for said audience. I mean, if I wanted to play a Call of Duty-esque game, I'd probably play Call of Duty. I know that a lot of people enjoyed RE4 -- some even considered it the best in the series to date -- but in my option that was the beginning of the end of the series, or at least the series that I fell in love with. I'm sure the games made after RE3 would be great as stand-alones, but when you have a devoted fan base of a particular genre (survival horror), why would you screw up the formula? Like others here have already stated, Dead Space is a great example of what RE could and should be, at least where the horror/action ratio is concerned. I just hope that the series can be redeemed and returned to its former glory, otherwise they'll be losing a lot of fans, myself included.
